definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)
pinyin: wen2 ming2 bu4 ru2 jian4 mian4

sentences.english: Essien this perfume also is famous for its manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 埃茲也以香水製造而聞名。

sentences.english: The Singapore government is famous for its successful policy that everyone has its own house.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡政府因住者有其屋政策的成功實施而聞名於世。

sentences.english: Rugao is a city which is famous for its residents' longevity.
sentences.chinese: 如皋，是一個因其居民長壽而聞名的地級市。

sentences.english: The gokagai of Kyoto are its five geisha districts, also known as hanamachi ("flower towns").
sentences.chinese: 京都的五花街是五大藝妓聚集區，也已花街聞名。

sentences.english: The restaurant is well-know for its cellar.
sentences.chinese: 這家餐館以它的窖藏酒聞名。

sentences.english: Cantonese sausage is well known for its particular appearance and flavor.
sentences.chinese: 廣式臘腸以其獨特的外觀和風味聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: Saxong is famous for its long history and rich cultural traditions.
sentences.chinese: 薩克森州以悠久的歷史和豐富的文化傳統而聞名於世。

sentences.english: Shanghai, known to the world as Oriental Pear, is China's eastern gate to the.
sentences.chinese: 以東方明珠聞名於世的上海市中國通向世界的東大門。

sentences.english: The town featured a rich history, and was well-known for its culture and traditions along its canals.
sentences.chinese: 青浦歷史悠久，以運河文化和傳統聞名。

sentences.english: The ancient Greek Parthenon is famed for its beautiful sculpture in bas-relief.
sentences.chinese: 古希臘的帕臺農神殿因其美麗的浮雕雕塑而聞名。

sentences.english: Thee King had a general called Yang Youchi who is very famous for his archery.
sentences.chinese: 國王有位將軍名叫楊有持，此人以箭術聞名。

sentences.english: One of Milan's claims to fame is their fashion industry.
sentences.chinese: 米蘭聞名於世的原因之一是它的時尚業。

sentences.english: The little restaurant is known to all locally.
sentences.chinese: 這家小餐館在當地遠近聞名。

sentences.english: Fujian lacquerware is known far and wide.
Tony was an experienced boxer and he was known for leading with his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 託尼是一個有經驗的拳擊家，他以左手出拳而聞名。

sentences.english: It is famous for its sunny, pleasant summer and long golden beaches.
sentences.chinese: 它以陽光明媚的怡人夏日和長長的金海岸而聞名。

definition: to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
